bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

div1.p: Isaac Van Bibber ads. Matilda free black girl
Action of trespass with force & arms damage $5000 July Term of the Circuit Court for St. Charles County

And the said Isaac the defendant by Carr his attorney comes and defends the charges of the wrong & injury whereof & says that he is not guilty in answer & for as is complained of against him with plaintiffs declaration & of this he puts himself upon the country.
And the plaintiff also M McGirk atto for plaintiff

And the said defendant furthermore pleads that on the day & at the place mentioned on the plaintiffs declaration and before that to wit on the nineteenth day of June eighteen hundred & nine she the said plaintiff was the slave & property of him the defendant & yet as his slave & property & that on the said last mentioned day he purchased the said Matilda of one William Christy whose property she then was & took & received from said Christy a bill of sale in the words & figures following trial For & in consideration of the sum of two hundred dollars To me in hand paid the receipt whereof I do hereby acknowledge, have granted bargained sale & (delivered) & by these present do grant bargain and sell & delivered unto Isaac Van Bibber a negro girl named Matilda I do hereby warrant & defend unto the said Van Bibber his heirs & assigns against me & my heirs & assigns all & every other person or persons lawfully claiming or to claim the same, in witness whereof I Have hereunto set my hand the 19th day of June 1809 signed W. Christy. Test. ? B, (?) ode BG Farrar "By virture of which said bill of sale which is here s he took in to his custody & received the plaintiff as his slave & property from said Christy all of which he is ready to verify &c wherefore he prays judgement of the plaintiffs actions ought not to be borne.
